Korsel Usir 2 Warga Korut karena Bunuh 16 Orang
07 Nov 2019, 16:56 by Rita Uli Hutapea
Seoul - Otoritas Korea Selatan (Korsel) mengusir dua pria Korea Utara (Korut) setelah mengetahui mereka telah membunuh 16 orang di kapal nelayan mereka sebelum kabur ke Korsel.
Kedua warga Korut itu, keduanya berumur 20-an tahun, diinterogasi oleh otoritas Korsel setelah ditemukan pada Sabtu (2/11) di dekat perbatasan maritim di Laut Timur, yang juga dikenal sebagai Laut Jepang. Hasil penyelidikan menyimpulkan bahwa kedua pria itu telah membunuh 16 nelayan Korut dan kemudian kabur ke Korsel.
Juru bicara Kementerian Unifikasi Korsel, Lee Sang-min mengatakan kepada para wartawan, kedua pria itu dideportasi ke Korut via desa Panmunjom pada Kamis (7/11) ini setelah memberitahu Pyongyang mengenai rencana deportasi tersebut.
"Jika mereka dimasukkan ke dalam masyarakat kita, maka dinilai bahwa mereka akan menjadi ancaman bagi kehidupan dan keselamatan masyarakat," kata Lee seperti dilansir kantor berita AFP, Kamis (7/11/2019).

South Korea expels 2 North Koreans for killing 16 people
Nov 7 2019, 16:56 by Rita Uli Hutapea
Seoul - The South Korean Authority (South Korea) expelled two North Korean men (North Korea) after learning they had killed 16 people on their fishing boat before escaping to South Korea.
The two North Koreans, both in their 20s, were interrogated by South Korean authorities after being found on Saturday (2/11) near the maritime border in the East Sea, also known as the Sea of Japan. The investigation concluded that the two men had killed 16 North Korean fishermen and then fled to South Korea.
South Korean Unification Ministry spokesman Lee Sang-min told reporters the two men were deported to North Korea via Panmunjom village on Thursday (7/11) after informing Pyongyang of the deportation plan.
"If they are included in our society, then it is considered that they will be a threat to people's lives and safety," Lee said as quoted by the AFP news agency on Thursday (11/07/2019).
